txt.en: 'And that is all I have to say on the matter, my friend.'
With Frodo's aid, Anborn hopes to capture Gollum at the Forbidden Pool.\n\nYou should listen to Anborn's tale.
'I bound the creature and blinded him with a hood lest he discover the way to Henneth Ann没n...'
Faramir, Anborn, and Frodo came to the overlook of Henneth Ann没n.\n\nYou should listen to Anborn's tale.
Anborn and Frodo travelled down to the Forbidden Pool.\n\nYou should listen to Anborn's tale.
'The gangrel-creature had come to the Forbidden Pool, and too close to Henneth Ann没n...'
Anborn recalls the tense exchange when the gangrel-creature came unbidden to the Forbidden Pool beneath Henneth Ann没n.
'The Halfling told of his connexion with the creature and offered to lead him to us...'
